channel.description:
I still get this error when I try to run it :S
[code]"Fatal error occured (4): Permission denied: connect"[/code]
I took down my firewall and deleted everything with the words minecraft in it. I don't know wtf :S

item.dc:creator: @riku9182 riku9182
item.description:
@riku9182 wrote:

[quote=“Rix_, post:10, topic:385042”]It was probably something to do with your Minecraft launcher because it didn’t have the socket permissions to “connect”.

/* net.minecraft.GameUpdater#updateClassPath */ protected void updateClassPath(File dir) throws Exception { ... if (classLoader == null) { classLoader = new URLClassLoader(urls) { protected PermissionCollection getPermissions(CodeSource codesource) { PermissionCollection perms = null; ... perms = (PermissionCollection) method.invoke(getClass().getClassLoader(), new Object[] { codesource }); String host = "www.minecraft.net"; if ((host != null) && (host.length() > 0)) { perms.add(new SocketPermission(host, "connect,accept")); } else { codesource.getLocation().getProtocol().equals("file"); } ... } } } }[/quote]
Thank’s.
It’s all fixed now

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Rixxx Rix_
item.description:
@Rixxx wrote:

It was probably something to do with your Minecraft launcher because it didn’t have the socket permissions to “connect”.

/* net.minecraft.GameUpdater#updateClassPath */ protected void updateClassPath(File dir) throws Exception { ... if (classLoader == null) { classLoader = new URLClassLoader(urls) { protected PermissionCollection getPermissions(CodeSource codesource) { PermissionCollection perms = null; ... perms = (PermissionCollection) method.invoke(getClass().getClassLoader(), new Object[] { codesource }); String host = "www.minecraft.net"; if ((host != null) && (host.length() > 0)) { perms.add(new SocketPermission(host, "connect,accept")); } else { codesource.getLocation().getProtocol().equals("file"); } ... } } } }

Read full topic

@riku9182 wrote:

Si Force:

I actually got that error yesterday whilst trying to run minecraft, but today I didn’t for whatever reason. Maybe try restarting your computer?

<3 you

item.dc:creator: @riku9182 riku9182
item.description:
@riku9182 wrote:

[quote=“LilXCj, post:6, topic:385042”][quote author=riku9182 link=topic=480809.msg3520392#msg3520392 date=1299363228]

It only auto downloads if you check the “force update” box.

I know >.>
[/quote]

Your problem has to be your computer, not the client.

Try uninstalling Java (jre and jdk) and re-installing them.

This may not work but it’s worth a try if you haven’t tried already.[/quote]
I did :l
I have the newest now

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

[quote=“riku9182, post:5, topic:385042”][quote author=Cole1497 link=topic=480809.msg3520391#msg3520391 date=1299363176]
It only auto downloads if you check the “force update” box.
[/quote]
I know >.>[/quote]

Your problem has to be your computer, not the client.

Try uninstalling Java (jre and jdk) and re-installing them.

This may not work but it’s worth a try if you haven’t tried already.
